description: In a crime-ridden future Japan, Kyohei Tachibana is a peaceful student at a culinary school, dreaming of going to France for advanced study as a patissier (pastry chef). To afford the trip, he accepts a part-time job as private cook to a strange group of women - Sei, Meg, Jo and Amy. To Kyohei's astonishment, they turn out to be a band of violent mercenaries, and he finds himself in the line of fire.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Triads
tags.description: Centered around Chinese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

node.description:
__Height:__ 162 cm

[Profile](http://office-anemone.com/mt-search.cgi?IncludeBlogs=4,5&tag=%e7%94%b0%e4%b8%ad%e7%90%86%e6%81%b5) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/rie-tanaka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanakarie) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCACBeSOH0iA0L2okeeigy5A/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rie_Tanaka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E4%B8%AD%E7%90%86%E6%81%B5_(%E5%A3%B0%E5%84%AA) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rieanesan/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@rieane3)

- She has starred in several anime series with [Megumi Toyoguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/95144/) in which their characters are part of the same teams.
- Rie's widely known favourite greeting sign is the V sign whenever she stands in front of a camera.
- She is a member of the Steel Angels, a singing trio composed of the three lead seiyuu of Steel Angel Kurumi--[Atsuko Enomoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95411/) and [Masayo Kurata](https://anilist.co/staff/95616/) included, and is responsible for its opening and end themes.
- Married to fellow voice actor [Koichi Yamadera](https://anilist.co/staff/95011) from 2012 to 2018.

**Non anime roles:**
- [Himeko Murata](https://anilist.co/character/142944/Himeko-Murata) - Honkai Impact (Video Game), Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- [Lisa](https://anilist.co/character/190867/Lisa/) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Valeriede - Memento Mori (VG)
- Kan-E-Senna - Final Fantasy XIV (VG)
- Isabel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Queen Dahlia - Tevi (VG)
- Queen Tahlia - Tevi (VG)
- Sweetheart - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Joanna Calendula - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)

__Height:__ 164.5 cm
__Hobbies:__ Game, Reading, Writing screenplays

[Profile (Office Osaka)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/watanabeakeno) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Chibirarijyotei)

Similar to many of her roles, she refers herself as "boku (僕)," the boyish way to call oneself in Japanese.

__Non-anime roles:__
[Hyuuga](https://anilist.co/character/153928/Hyuuga) - Azur Lane (VG)

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

A voice actress and producer specializing in televised anime. Harp was hired by FUNimation Entertainment in 2003 to voice the character of Tweedledee in Kiddy Grade. Since then, her work has included Sei in Burst Angel, Sanae in Akira Kurosawa's Samurai 7, Hibari Ginza in Speed Grapher and additional roles in Yu Yu Hakusho, Spiral, Fullmetal Alchemist, Case Closed, Desert Punk, Baki the Grappler, The Galaxy Railways, Negima, and BECK.    Her portrayal as Hibari Ginza in the 2006-2007 release of Speed Grapher won her an award in the ADR Awards as voted by members of the websites Dub Review and Anime on DVD.    Harp is also the inspiration for Aubrey Chorde, one of the main characters in the webcomic Something Positive by her friend R.K. Milholland. He claims he decided to make the comic after she told him to do "something positive" with his life. She currently lives and works in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area of Texas. Her hobbies include knitting, crafts and collecting Hello Kitty Memorabilia. (Wikipedia)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
Kouichi Oohata is a director and mecha designer best known for creating the Gunbuster from *Top wo Nerae!*

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.
Barry Watson is president and CEO of Illumitoon Entertainment. He was formerly a producer and voice director for FUNimation Entertainment.

Ilustrator and Director specialized in OPs and Game Cutscenes. 

His work stands out for the vibrant color schemes, prominent character animation and tendency to interlace different portions of the screen.

**Notable works outside anime:**

- Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 (Videogame, 2006) (OP Director, Animation Cutscene Director, Animation Director)
- Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 - Portable (Videogame, 2009) (OP Director, OP Animation Director, OP Editing)
